text: Gmail app does support responsive but because the HubSpot template builder uses attribute selectors td[class~="column"], responsive doesn't work. Gmail doesn't support attribute selectors at all and strips them out. Our solution has been to convert our templates to HTML and change all attribute selectors to standard classes and IDs. <https://www.emailonacid.com/blog/article/email-development/12_things_you_must_know_when_developing_for_gmail_and_gmail_mobile_apps>
does anyone know if you can use HubL to read in from an xml or kml file that is hosted in the design manager?

So this is an issue that has haunted me for a while. Wanted to see if you developers had any ideas. We use Typeform for one client and WooCommerce for another. With both, we use zapier to ad submissions to HubSpot. Using Zapier we lose the original source information and contacts are added as "Offline Sources." Any idea how we might resolve this?
We tried hiding a HubSpot form on the page that copied an email address when typed in woo and submitted upon the woo form submission. Doesn't seem to work though.
